title: Coronavirus: Do face masks work? And other questions answered
description: The BBC's Fergus Walsh and expert Sian Griffiths answer your questions about the virus outbreak.

title: Greek coast guards fire into sea near migrant boat
description: The dinghy was also shoved around with boats by coast guards trying to force it back towards Turkey.

title: What is Super Tuesday and how does it work?
description: Fourteen states will pick who they want to run against Trump. We may soon know the likely nominee.

title: Coronavirus: Widespread transmission in UK 'highly likely'
description: A public health chief warns the country must be prepared as the PM chairs an emergency meeting.

title: Post-Brexit US trade: UK talks plan insists NHS 'off the table'
description: The UK sets out its strategy for trade talks with US - as separate talks with the EU get under way.

title: Worcester and Shropshire flooding 'not over yet'
description: The Environment Agency warns people not to get "complacent" as warnings remain on the Severn.

title: Six Nations organisers will 'not rule anything out' after paywall reports
description: Six Nations organisers say they "would not rule anything out" after reports it would no longer be on free-to-air television from 2022.

title: Coronavirus: South Korea church leader apologises for virus spread
description: Lee Man-hee got down on his knees and said the disease's spread was "not intentional".

title: Met Police officers investigated over Streatham attack crash
description: The inquiry into two Met Police officers' response to the knife attack is branded a "complete joke".

title: M&S: Retailer extends trial of food refill scheme
description: Shoppers can fill their own containers in two stores, as the firm tries to cut down on plastic waste.

title: Judge Judy to end in 2021 after 25 years
description: The daytime TV star reveals she will launch a new show, Judy Justice, on an unnamed network in 2022.

title: Joshua to fight Pulev at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in June
description: British world champion Anthony Joshua will fight Kubrat Pulev at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium on Saturday 20 June.

title: Joe Lycett: Comedian changes his name to Hugo Boss
description: Lycett is taking a stand against the fashion firm over its treatment of similarly-named companies.

title: Vatican to open archives of Holocaust-era Pope Pius XII
description: Scholars have waited decades to see papers from the controversial reign of Pius XII.

title: Coronavirus: Bank of England vows to ease economic impact
description: The bank has promised to help stabilise financial markets amid growing concern about coronavirus.

title: England prop Vunipola available for Wales match
description: England prop Mako Vunipola is available for Saturday's Six Nations match against Wales after missing the Ireland game for personal reasons.

title: Australia reach World Cup semis and knock out NZ
description: Defending champions Australia avoid an early exit at the T20 World Cup with a four-run victory over New Zealand putting them into the semi-finals.

title: Pete Buttigieg drops out of Democratic race for White House
description: The 38-year-old became the first openly gay major-party presidential candidate last year.

title: GB will not dominate Tokyo Olympics after Worlds 'shock' - Hoy
description: Britain will not dominate the Tokyo Olympics as they have in previous Games after the "shock" of the World Championships, says Sir Chris Hoy.

title: The Papers: 'Shut down' cities warning as UK virus cases jump
description: The ongoing coronavirus outbreak features heavily on many front pages for another day.

title: From Mickey Mouse to Arsenal FA Cup shock? - Portsmouth's Disney-inspired revival
description: Having endured a troubled few years, Portsmouth have much to look forward to under former Walt Disney chief executive Michael Eisner.

title: Criminals on CCTV: Scammers caught red-handed
description: The man who hacked into a criminal call centre to expose scammers at work.

title: Syria war: Turkish drone strikes 'kill 19 Syrian soldiers'
description: Turkey, which backs the Syrian opposition, targets government forces after a spike in tensions.

title: Letter from Africa: Ethiopia's lost Armenian community
description: A church and a social club remain as echoes of a once thriving group which played an important role in the country.

title: ‘My toy walrus waited 25 years in the Arctic’
description: Julia spent 25 years dreaming of her first home. Eventually she returned - and found a long-lost toy.

title: UK military gears up for deployment in Mali
description: Troops will join a mission in Mali to help combat the world's fastest growing Islamist-led insurgency.

title: Flooding: Storm Dennis is 'a taste of things to come' for Wales
description: Experts paint a bleak picture for areas of Wales clearing up after recent storm damage.

title: Netflix's Cheer: Inside the world of the UK's student cheerleaders
description: "It's not other teams we're cheering on, it's ourselves."

title: Two thirds of UK homes 'fail on energy efficiency targets'
description: Evidence suggests improving housing is one of the most cost-effective ways to cut carbon emissions.

title: 'I was abused - now I want to give hope to others'
description: Rhys Dickinson is using his own experience of child sex abuse to help give young survivors a voice.

title: Australian night sky on show in 'starlapse' video
description: One man’s love for Queensland’s night skies results in beautiful timelapse images.

title: The friends helping people divorce without lawyers
description: Kate Daly and Pip Wilson are the founders of solicitor-free divorce service Amicable.

title: The kids making up to $1m a year on YouTube
description: Child influencers on the platform test their power at New York's annual Toy Fair.

title: How powerful is Dominic Cummings?

title: Training troops for the 'world's most dangerous' peacekeeping mission
description: The British Army is preparing to send troops into Mali, to join a UN peacekeeping mission.

title: The UK’s first climate change refugees?
description: Fairbourne is the first community set to be decommissioned due to rising sea levels.

title: US election 2020: Why is the Latino vote so important?
description: In the 2020 election, Latinos will be the largest racial or ethnic minority voting. What are their political priorities?
